But it isn't as simple as you put it; there are always going to 
problems associated with the solution, . Hell, we won't know if this 
possible solution will work till you try.

You don't have to be a GM to aissimilate the characters, just ask 
their owners about controling them. I suggest that you do it, cause 
I can't. It's exam crunch time, and i've got 5 final exams in the 
next week and a bit. I will make sure to post with my characters.
It's 5:30am, i'm going to sleep.
